title: Musk’s Plan to Remove Block Feature on X Raises Concerns About Harassment
description: Users and advocates have raised concerns about what removing the "block" feature could mean for targets of harassment.

title: Why Music Manager Scooter Braun Is At the Center of a Media Storm
description: Scooter Braun is at the center of media speculation following reports that Ariana Grande and Demi Lovato have parted ways with the manager

title: 3 Issues Likely to Be Hot Topics at the First GOP Debate
description: Former President Donald Trump is skipping the debate but his presence will be unavoidable.

title: How an Unknown Country Singer Topped the Charts—and Sparked Debate
description: Oliver Anthony's 'Rich Men North of Richmond' has shot up the Billboard charts while becoming a talking point for conservative politicians.

title: Everything You Need to Know About the Star Wars TV Show Ahsoka
description: After making her live-action debut in 'The Mandalorian,' Ahsoka Tano now has her very own galaxy far, far away spinoff series.

title: Hawaii Already Had a Massive Homelessness Problem. The Maui Wildfires Are Making It Worse
description: Hawaii has the fifth highest rate of homelessness in the U.S. The wildfires now make it harder to help Maui's unhoused population.

title: The Face Of Rural Addiction is Not What You Think
description: Despite the media's focus on rural whites, drug addition is rising among rural Blacks.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried Pleads Not Guilty Again to Narrower FTX Fraud Indictment
description: The embattled crypto mogul appeared in federal court in Manhattan on Tuesday for the first time since a judge revoked his bail.

title: The First Televised Presidential Debate Isn’t What You Think It Was
description: Many people think of the 1960 Kennedy-Nixon debate. But some argue the first televised presidential debate was four years earlier.

title: Greek Authorities Say 18 Bodies Found in an Area Struck by a Major Wildfire
description: Authorities are examining if 18 bodies found in the area of a major wildfire in Greece might have been migrants.

title: Ecuadorians Vote to Stop Oil Drilling in the Amazon Rainforest
description: This Sunday, Ecuadorians voted to end oil drilling in the Yasuni rainforest, one of the most biodiverse regions of the world.

title: Fukushima Nuclear Plant To Release Treated Radioactive Water To Sea As Soon As Thursday
description: Fukushima nuclear power plant will start releasing treated and diluted radioactive wastewater into the Pacific Ocean as early as Thursday.

title: What Caused Tropical Storm Hilary’s Record-Breaking Rainfall
description: A combination of El Nino, climate change, a heat dome, and other factors cooked up Tropical Storm Hilary.

title: Thailand’s Populist Pheu Thai Party Finally Won the Prime Minister Vote—But at What Cost?
description: Srettha Thavisin was elected Prime Minister by Thailand’s parliament after his populist Pheu Thai party joined forces with the conservative establishment.

title: We Need to Rethink Wildfire in Order to Better Protect Ourselves
description: Wildfires are changing as the climate heats up. People need to rethink how they protect themselves and their homes.

title: Why the Nation’s Largest School District Is Making Virtual School a Permanent Option
description: Administrators say they have studied what works and what doesn’t from remote-schooling during the pandemic.

title: Why Soaring Indian Onion Prices May Hurt Modi More Than Tomatoes
description: Table food prices are crucial for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who will seek a third five-year term in national elections next year.

title: Cambodian Parliament Approves Longtime Leader’s Son as Prime Minister
description: The son of longtime autocratic Cambodian leader Hun Sen was approved as the new prime minister by Parliament as part of generational change.

title: Why Trump and His Supporters Keep Calling Democrats ‘Fascists’
description: Republican audiences have come to associate fascists and Nazis with ideological leftism. How did that happen?

title: Europe’s Sweeping New Rules for Big Tech Are About to Kick In. Here’s What to Know
description: The first phase of the European Union’s groundbreaking new digital rules will take effect this week. Which platforms are affected? What’s changing? And what about the rest of the world?

title: Hundreds of Former Afghan Officials Have Been Killed Since the Taliban Took Over, U.N. Says
description: The groups most targeted by the Taliban have been former army, police and intelligence forces, according to the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan.

title: Exiled Former Thai Leader Thaksin Shinawatra Trades Democratic Progress for Return Home
description: The former populist leader arrived in Bangkok as his party Pheu Thai struck a deal—in a blow to the country’s growing democracy movement—with the establishment.

title: North Korean Airline Lands in Beijing Marking First International Flight Since COVID
description: Flight data indicates an Air Koryo passenger jet flew from Pyongyang to Beijing on Tuesday, in a sign of easing border restrictions that could repatriate North Korea’s stranded nationals abroad and increase trade with its powerful neighbor.

title: North Korea to Try Another Satellite Launch as South Korea Holds Meetings and Military Drills With Allies
description: North Korea reportedly plans to fire off a space rocket as South Korea and the U.S. conduct joint military drills that have riled Pyongyang.

title: Why Putin Is Dialing In to the BRICS Summit Rather Than Attending in Person
description: An International Criminal Court arrest warrant issued for the Russian president put summit host South Africa in a sticky situation.
